Class AdventureGame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  AdventureGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class AdventureGame
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener

COPYRIGHT (C) 2005 Rob Bauer. All Rights Reserved.

Handles game play, game rules, and setting up and maintaining the graph of rooms.

Version:
1.0 2005-NOV-08
Author:
Rob Bauer
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constant Field Values

STARTROOM

private static final java.lang.String STARTROOM
Keep track of which room will be the starting room (this allows the room to appear anywhere in the castle.dat file or get renamed to something new.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

selectmode

private int selectmode
Keep track of the numeric select mode we are currently in. This may be to specify if the player is selecting an item to pick up, remove, or use. 0 = do nothing 1 = take 2 = remove 3 = use 4 = hag takes something

gamestart

private boolean gamestart
Identify the start of the game - this allows the check in roomInfo() to not kill the player at the very beginning of the game.

itemused

private java.util.ArrayList<RoomItem> itemused
A list of items used while the player was in the current room

WELCOMEMSG

private static final java.lang.String WELCOMEMSG
Welcome message text. This is displayed to the user when they start the game.

private javax.swing.JTextArea createJEditorPane()
Setup the editor pane. This pane is to simulate a console window.

Returns:
JTextArea containing a prepared editor pane

loadFile

public void loadFile(java.lang.String filename)
Load the specified file and parse it. While parsing, populate a graph. The graph will represent the game's rooms. Each room will contain an array of edges which will also be determined from the specified file.

Parameters:
filename -

printMessage

public void printMessage(java.lang.String sText)
Print a string to the display. Add a carriage return after it.

Parameters:
sText - String containing the message to display.

debug

private void debug()
Provide debug output to the user interface. To be used to verify the quality of the castle/rooms (aka: graph).

roomInfo

public void roomInfo()
Displays current room info as well as the cursor. Also performs a check if the user returned to the entrance hall and determines if they won the game or not.

currentRoomInfo

private java.lang.String currentRoomInfo()
Get the current room and format the the information to let the user know where they are and what doors are available.

Returns:
String containing the room info

showCursor

public void showCursor()
Show the cursor on the display

makeMove

private void makeMove(char direction)
Make a move. The direction specifies the direction. Make sure this is a valid direction the player can go in. If it is, set the player's current room to the new room.

Parameters:
direction - char direction to go in (N, E, S, W)

flee

private void flee()
The player has requested to flee. Start here and find the shortest path. Then display the path to the player.

fleepath2String

private java.lang.String fleepath2String(java.util.ArrayList<DSPRoomSet> fleepath)
Convert the fleepath array list to a string suitable for output to the user. Work backwords on the fleepath array list. By doing so, we can traverse the array from the entrance way and find matching rooms which will adventually lead back to our current room. Trick is to build the output string just right so the rooms appear in logical order (display the current room first, then the next room is the room the user would go to next to make their way to the entrance).

Parameters:
fleepath - the array list containing the flee path to take. It is an array of DSPRoomSet objects.
Returns:
String with a user-friendly flee path description

listItems

public java.lang.String listItems(Room room)
Create a user-friendly string containing the list of items found in a room.

Parameters:
room - Room to check for items
Returns:
string containing the list of items, formatted and ready for output to the user

take

public void take()
If possible, take a room item and place in the backpack. If there's only one item and its moveable, then automatically take it. Otherwise, present a choice to the user and allow them to select which item to take.

takeRoomItem

public void takeRoomItem(int item)
Take the the item the player selected and remove it from the room and add it to the player's backpack (as long as the backpack has room).

Parameters:
item - index of the item to take

removeItem

public void removeItem()
Remove an item from the player's backpack - first show a list of items available to be removed.

removeBackpackItem

public void removeBackpackItem(int index)
Remove an item from the player's backpack.

Parameters:
index - Index value of the item to remove from the backpack (its 1 based, will need to subtract one to make it zero based)

selectUseItem

public void selectUseItem()
Use an item - remove the item from the player's backpack.

useItem

public void useItem(int index)
Allow the player to use an item. Figure out which item the player selected, determine if it exists in the backpack, then use it.

Parameters:
index -

displayList

public java.lang.String displayList(java.util.ArrayList<RoomItem> backpack)
Loop through all the items in the list and format the item name for output to the user as a selection item.

Parameters:
backpack - list of items to display
Returns:
string formatted and ready for display

abortItemSelect

public void abortItemSelect(java.lang.String mode)
Abort the item select and reset the selection mode.

Parameters:
mode - text to display to the user to specify the mode they were in

playCharacters

private void playCharacters(Room room)
Play any characters in the room (add/subtract health, etc).

Parameters:
room - Room to check for characters

itemWasUsed

private boolean itemWasUsed(RoomItem item)
Check if a given item was used in the current room

Parameters:
item - item to check if it was used
Returns:
true if item was used, otherwise false

charactersAlive

private void charactersAlive(RoomItem item)
Check the item used and if the right item is used, remove (kill) the associated character in the room, if it exists.

Parameters:
item - Item the player used

showHelp

public void showHelp()
Provide the player some help.
